This shifts the expert’s role from manual lookup to informed validation, while keeping full transparency and auditability. In practice, teams can expect significantly less effort spent on repetitive classification tasks, up to a 50% reduction, while lowering the risk of non-compliance.

 

Accounting Accruals Agent

Period-end accruals are a familiar pressure point in finance: important, repetitive, and often constrained by tight timelines. The beta version of the Accounting Accruals Agent tackles this challenge by supporting teams with proposing accruals based on accounting policy documents, historical data, and calculated values, helping shift the work from manual preparation to focused review. Accrual proposals are presented directly in the ‘Manage Accrual Proposals’ app, along with clear explanations that show how each figure was derived. This transparency makes it easier for general ledger accountants to validate and post accruals with confidence, without losing control over the process. As a result, teams can reduce the time spent on period-end activities while maintaining consistency and auditability, supporting a smoother close cycle.

For more information, see Accounting Accruals Agent.

 

Embedded AI highlights

Sales

Automatic creation of sales orders from unstructured data (premium) - AnyDOX adoption

Sales teams often receive purchase orders in formats that don’t fit neatly into systems, PDFs attached to emails, scanned documents, or images that still require careful manual entry. With the current release, internal sales representatives can upload these unstructured files and let the system extract the relevant information into a sales order request, proposing values such as the sold-to party based on the document content. What used to be a repetitive transcription task becomes a short review step, allowing sales teams to focus more on customer interactions and less on administrative work. Multilanguage support and the ability to train the extraction logic through SAP Document AI help ensure the process works reliably across regions and document types. The result is a smoother order intake process that reduces manual effort while keeping sales operations responsive and consistent.

Check out this dedicated page on SAP Help Portal to learn more.

 

Finance

Period comparisons and AI insights for product profitability review booklet

Looking at product profitability often starts with a simple question: What changed and why? The latest enhancements to the product profitability review booklet help sales accountants explore this question more systematically by introducing period comparisons for margins and cost of goods sold. Built-in views for margin overview and COGS breakdown are complemented by AI-generated insights that highlight notable developments between periods, offering guidance on where a closer look may be worthwhile. Additional dimensions, functional currency display, and an extensible CDS view support more flexible market segment analysis without losing consistency. Together with the new commenting feature, this creates a clearer, more connected view of product performance that supports informed discussions and decisions.

For more information, discover enhancements in the product profitability review booklet.

 

Manufacturing

AI-assisted production routing proposal and copy routing

Creating a new production routing often starts by searching for something that already exists and adapting it to fit, an approach that works, but takes time and careful attention. The newly introduced innovation, AI-assisted production routing proposal and copy routing, supports production engineers, planners, and master data specialists by identifying similar routings based on material names, descriptions, and bills of material. Instead of rebuilding routings from the ground up, users receive suggestions they can copy and adjust, turning setup work into a focused refinement step. This helps reduce repetitive data entry and lowers the risk of inconsistencies across routings. Over time, teams benefit from faster setup, more consistent master data, and a smoother path from planning to production.

Eager to learn more? Check out our dedicated pages on intelligent scenario to find similar materials for routing proposal and creating a routing using the AI-assisted material search.

 

 

Cross topic: Situation handling

AI-assisted situation handling (beta)

When critical issues surface in day-to-day operations, the real challenge is often not awareness but knowing what to do next. This is where AI-assisted situation handling comes into play, supporting business users by complementing automated alerts with context-aware guidance tailored to their roles and responsibilities. By capturing situation data together with its business context, the system can generate targeted recommendations that help users assess options and act more quickly. Customizable prompts and the ability to incorporate data from SAP, third-party, and external sources ensure that advice reflects real operational conditions. In practice, this leads to faster resolution of situations, cutting response times by up to 70%, and helps teams stay focused on decisions rather than diagnostics.

 

 

Joule innovations highlights

Procurement

Conversational search for local and central purchase requisition status

Tracking the status of a purchase requisition often means switching between apps, systems, and document numbers just to answer a simple question. With the latest updates, conversational search in Joule allows procurement users to ask directly about the status of local or central purchase requisitions and their follow-on documents, without navigating into multiple SAP Fiori apps. Users can reference familiar identifiers, such as requisition numbers, connected-system document IDs, or SAP Ariba cart numbers and receive the relevant status in one place. This shortens the path from question to answer and reduces interruptions in daily work. Over time, procurement teams gain faster visibility into requisition progress and can respond to inquiries with greater confidence and less effort.

 

Conversational search for centrally managed purchase requisition status

Similarly to the innovation described above, conversational search in Joule allows users to check the approval and follow-on document status of centrally managed purchase requisitions without switching between SAP Fiori apps. A simple query is enough to see whether a requisition has progressed to a purchase order, acknowledgment, goods receipt, or invoice receipt. This removes friction from everyday follow-ups and helps teams stay informed without interrupting their workflow. As a result, procurement professionals can respond faster to internal requests and keep processes moving smoothly.

 
Conversational search for central procurement business documents

In central procurement , finding the right document often means knowing exactly where to look and having the time to navigate there. With this release conversational search in Joule allows users to search and filter central procurement business documents simply by asking, whether they are looking for contracts nearing expiration, rejected supplier confirmations, or purchase orders tied to a specific supplier or system. Results are presented together with direct navigation links to the relevant SAP Fiori apps, turning search into a natural entry point rather than a separate task. This makes it easier to move from question to action without breaking focus. Over time, procurement teams gain faster access to the information they need and more confidence in managing centrally governed processes.

 

Don’t miss: The GenAI extensibility assistant

As we roll out the new 2602 features, we also want to highlight a game-changer from the previous cycle that is rapidly becoming a standard for key users. If you haven't yet explored the GenAI-based extensibility assistant, now is the time. This tool allows key users to generate custom fields and logic simply by describing their requirements in natural language. It’s not just about speed; it ensures your logic is consistent and "clean core" compliant by design. To see this assistant in action and learn how to enable it, check out this deep dive on extensibility assistant for key users.

 

Summary 

📽 Register for our SAP Cloud ERP 2602 Early Release Series! 

Between January 12-16, we are hosting a series of 22 expert-led live sessions to highlight the exciting innovations shipped with the SAP Cloud ERP 2602 release. On our landing page you can register for the entire series or pick the sessions most relevant to you. 

🔎 Find all our assets  

The release 2602 showcases more than 130 innovation highlights across the portfolio. Check out our release document for all the details!

We at Cloud ERP and SCM Product Success offer a service as versatile as our product itself. Check out the numerous offerings our team has created for you below:

entry.title: SAP Fiori Development newsletter January 2026 (issue #38)
entry.content:
Happy New Year. If 2025 was the year of AI, what will 2026 bring? Likely more AI.

Some predictions:

  1. Vibe coding will become more mainstream with MCP servers and LLMs working together to deliver more predictable and consistent results.
  2. We will start to see the emergence of the “post-app” era in enterprise software. I don’t think it will be entirely chat-based, but I do expect some parts to be generated on demand.
  3. The knowledge gap between developers who use AI and those who don’t will continue to grow. Now, the early adopters have a 1-year head start. For those who choose to remain on the sidelines, that will continue to grow. Don’t be that person – you need to start experimenting with AI, even if you don’t include the results in your production code

What are your predictions for 2026? Let us know or add to the comments below. If you want to discuss your thoughts with your fellow developers, I encourage you to join our monthly SAP Fiori development roundtable. Register online or email me for an invitation.

Development News

The complete 6-part SAP Fiori Development Portal blog series
In this 6-part series, Katrin Polloczek and Marcel Waechter explore the SAP Fiori development portal and how to use it. Topics include SAP Fiori elements, building blocks, extension options, custom pages, and how all these pieces fit together. Read part 1 – with links to all the posts.

SAP Fiori tools 2601 update – Mobile Device Preview, Building Blocks, and AI-Driven Productivity
SAP Fiori tools 2601 includes enhancements for previewing applications, managing system connections, building SAP Fiori elements–based UIs, and accelerating development with AI-powered tooling. In parallel, we continue to refine the fundamentals in security, modeling, and extensibility. See details.

Joule in SAP Build Code can now create freestyle UI5 apps
Last year, we introduced the SAPUI5 extension for the Joule coding assistant in SAP Build Code Over time, it has evolved to support conversion of UI5 apps to TypeScript and setting up new pages and the respective navigation. The latest improvement lets you create new freestyle UI5 apps according to your requirements, bringing the functionality right to developers using SAP Build Code—no other tools needed. Discover how it works.

Inside Joule: Lessons from building an AI coding assistant for SAP Build
This is a "making of" article about the implementation of the new /ui5-create-app slash command available within Joule in SAP Build Code. This new feature enables a conversation between an application developer and their AI assistant about building a new freestyle UI5 application. Learn more.

UI5 MCP Server's New TypeScript Migration Feature
The new UI5 MCP server will give you a massive head start on converting your existing JavaScript UI5 apps to TypeScript. A multi-day manual conversion becomes an hour of agent work plus several hours of polishing. The time savings add up with each project. Learn more.

Harmonizing UI5 URLs: Convenient URLs for SAPUI5/OpenUI5 CDN
When accessing the UI5 Demo Kit and when using UI5 in cloud scenarios, you use URLs like https://ui5.sap.com/. We are harmonizing these URLs to make them future-proof. See more details.

Events

SAP Fiori Innovation Day 2025 is a wrap. The final event in Walldorf included an overview of AI capabilities in SAP Cloud ERP, two hands-on exercises, and some great insights from the sponsoring partners. Learn the details.

We are planning more SAP Fiori Innovation Days in 2026. Watch your inbox for announcements about where and when we will be hosting these events.

 

Call for papers is open for SAP Sapphire 2026Call for Proposals open for 2026 SAP Sapphire & ASUG Annual Conference Orlando.
Share your success story or lead an interactive discussion with your peers. 
Submit your proposal.

Back issues from the past year

SAP Fiori development newsletter September 2025 (issue #36)

SAP Fiori development newsletter July 2025 (issue #35)

SAP FIori development newsletter May 2025 (Issue #34)

entry.title: New Expert-Guided Implementation: Joule Prerequisites and Activation
entry.content:
Establish the Foundation for Your AI Journey 

SAP Joule is transforming how organizations interact with SAP applications by bringing intelligence directly into everyday workflows. For customers to activate Joule and unlock its AI-powered capabilities, they must first prepare their SAP Cloud Identity Services (CIS), SAP Business Technology Platform (BTP), and integration foundations to fully realize the value of Joule from day one. 

To support customers with this essential preparation, we are pleased to introduce a new Expert-Guided Implementation (EGI):  

Joule Prerequisites & Activation - a hands-on, expert-led program designed to help you configure all required technical components for a smooth Joule activation. 

This new offering helps customers understand Joule’s architecture, explore deployment options, configure platform prerequisites, and establish the identity and access foundation required for a secure activation. By the end of the EGI, participants will be positioned to complete all the prerequisites required to activate Joule, ensuring a seamless start to their AI adoption journey. 

Workshop Schedule 

To accommodate global participants, this session will be offered on the following dates and time zones as follows: 

2026 DatesTimeTime Zone 
January 19-2010:00AM - 12:00PMEMEA | CET
January 26-2711:00AM - 1:00PMNA/LA | EST 
February 9-1010:00AM-12:00PMEMEA | CET
February 16-1711:00AM - 1:00PMNA/LA | EST 
March 2-310:00AM-12:00PMEMEA | CET
March 9-1011:00AM - 1:00PMNA/LA | EST 


Why This EGI Matters 

Before Joule can be activated, customers must ensure the right technical prerequisites are in place—across SAP BTP, Cloud Identity Services, Build Work Zone, and Line-of-Business systems. This EGI provides: 

  • A clear, step-by-step path to completing these prerequisites 
  • Expert-led guidance for setting up SAP Cloud Identity Services including Identity Authentication Service (IAS)/Identity Provisioning Service (IPS), and entitlements 
  • Live configuration guidance in your SAP BTP environment and SAP Build Workzone (BWZ) 
  • Hands-on support through real examples and troubleshooting 

With AI rapidly becoming central to SAP’s product strategy, organizations need the right technical foundation to adopt Joule with confidence, security, and scalability. 

What You’ll Learn: Program Overview 

This 2-day EGI blends instruction, demonstrations, and guided hands-on exercises. 

Day 1 – Foundation & Architecture 

  • Understand Joule’s system architecture and deployment scenarios 
  • Learn how SAP Cloud Identity Services (IAS/IPS), SAP BTP, SAP Build Work Zone, and LOB solutions work together 
  • Navigate BTP global accounts, subaccounts, entitlements, and subscriptions 
  • Validate system readiness and begin configuring your Joule environment 
  • Experience a live demonstration of Joule integrated with SAP SuccessFactors 

Day 2 – Identity, Provisioning & Work Zone Integration 

  • Deep-dive into SAP Cloud Identity Services - Identity Authentication (IAS) and Identity Provisioning (IPS) for Joule 
  • Integrate CIS with your corporate Identity Provider 
  • Configure SAP Build Workzone (BWZ) as the unified interface for Joule 
  • Establish trust relationships between systems 
  • Expose LOB content to BWZ and validate provisioning flows 


What You Will Achieve 

This new EGI equips your organization with everything needed to prepare for Joule activation, ensuring compliance, security, and a streamlined technical foundation from day one. 

If your organization is planning to adopt SAP Joule or preparing for AI-driven innovation within SAP applications, this EGI is the ideal starting point to fast-track your readiness and reduce implementation risk. 

By the end of the EGI, you will have: 

  • A configured SAP BTP environment with a designated Joule subaccount 
  • Completed IAS/IPS setup for secure authentication and provisioning 
  • Integrated BWZ as the experience layer for Joule 
  • Verified all activation prerequisites using a comprehensive readiness checklist 
  • Gained expert-backed confidence to run the Joule Booster and proceed with activation

How to Register 

Register here to secure your spot* today to learn from SAP experts and gain the skills to bring Business AI to life across your enterprise.

 * You may need to register your S-user for access to SAP Learning Hub to access the EGI registration page.  It is a one-time registration, click here.

Related Articles

Unlocking Joule and SAP Business AI from Strategy to Activation: Expert-Guided Implementation

entry.title: SAP Sales Cloud: Q4 2025 Innovation Highlights
entry.content:
SAP Sales Cloud: Q4 2025 Innovation Highlights

With a robust set of AI-first innovations already delivered throughout 2025, SAP Sales Cloud’s Q4 update continues to expand intelligent capabilities, flexibility, extensibility, and key workflow enhancements to maximize sales productivity. This blog will cover a few key feature highlights that are worth a closer look. For a more in-depth showcase on these capabilities and more, we invite you to register for the SAP Sales Cloud Innovation and Foundation webcast on Wednesday, January 28th. Register today to stay on top of new innovations and enhancements, as well as exciting details on our 2026 solution roadmap.

Additional innovation resources: SAP CX Portfolio    l    SAP Service Cloud and ESM

What’s New in SAP Sales Cloud

Naturally 2025 was a year of enhancing and embedding agentic AI capabilities within SAP Sales Cloud and the extended lead-to-cash value chain, but we also released a significant number of enhancements around ease of use, specific customer requests, quality-of-life improvements for admins, Joule for B2B sales, and developments designed to further streamline sales processes with deep integration and infused AI. Additionally, the AI agent builder continues to be enhanced so users can easily create and deploy agentic B2B sales use cases in clicks. With so many exciting new features and enhancements we can’t cover them all here… so without further ado, here are four highlights from our Q4 2025 SAP Sales Cloud release to dig into.   

AI-enhanced Quote Generation

Opportunities are constantly changing as deals progress, especially in complex deal cycles with detailed configuration or changing requirements. SAP Sales Cloud’s AI-enhanced Quote Generation helps remove guesswork and reduces manual effort by automatically creating draft quotes. The solution’s quotation AI agent works in the background, reading and analyzing rich data and email content for key information. From the data analysis, Sales Cloud extracts customer intent and intended product line items, automatically creating a draft quote for the appropriate opportunity. Commonly referred to as “AI – Email to Quote”, this feature replaces manual configuration and helps sales organizations shorten response times. Sellers are then free to quickly review, augment if needed, and send the quote without being bogged down in complexity.

SAP Sales Cloud + Microsoft Teams: Chat Experience

Our existing release of SAP Sales Cloud already included deep integration with Microsoft Teams, but our Q4 2025 release greatly expanded this experience with embedded Chat. Now users can Teams Chat directly within SAP Sales Cloud. Peer-to-peer, meeting follow up, or group chats are seamlessly supported so users can start, view, and continue key conversations without leaving Sales Cloud. This enhancement helps users stay connected, faster without losing context or needing to switch between applications. Customer-related communication is tied to the relevant CRM data so users can engage, collaborate, and progress deals quickly.

AI Duplicate Check Enhancement

Legacy CRM systems often have notoriously bad or duplicate data for a variety of reasons, but we are determined to make this issue a thing of the past. SAP Sales Cloud follows clean core development principles and our vision for data quality and orchestration is an extension of this mindset. As we look to the future of B2B sales, AI is and will play a critical role, but AI is only as good as the data it consumes. AI Duplicate Check within Sales Cloud uses embedded intelligence to uncover loose, partial, and soft match duplicates so users can easily unite and clean records to improve quality with little effort. Our Q4 2025 update strengthens these capabilities and has been optimized to help sellers with lead flow. Once a seller has qualified a lead and is ready to move the prospect into an opportunity cycle, AI Duplicate Check reviews CRM data and guides the user to link the lead / converted opportunity to the appropriate account or CRM records. This feature can dramatically simplify lead conversion while improving user experience and data quality.

Subscription Contracts and Renewals

With ongoing market disruption and quickly evolving industry trends, flexible business models and dynamic solution offerings continue to rise in popularity. In this regard we have enhanced SAP Sales Cloud’s ability to better support subscription offerings with high complexity through a deep integration with SAP CPQ. Now users can easily create subscription contracts or solution renewals for complex offerings from an opportunity with just a few clicks. The streamlined integration unites Sales Cloud, CPQ, and SAP Cloud ERP, providing a consistent subscription flow from opportunity, to quote, to order, and contract. Once fulfilled account and opportunity records automatically synchronize, providing a clear and consistent source of truth.

Ready for more?

We’re very excited to showcase these and more highlights on the SAP Sales Cloud Innovation and Foundation webcast on Wednesday, January 28th. In addition to a deeper dive and solution demonstration of these features, we will also share upcoming roadmap items and answer questions in real-time. To dive deeper into specific use cases or for a personalize showcase drop us a note on SAP.com.

entry.title: From Hype to Hands-On: Level Up Your AI Skills This January
entry.content:
In the age of AI, the skills we build today will define how we work tomorrow. That’s why we’ve launched a monthly series of blogs that spotlight the latest AI learning assets and upcoming learning opportunities. This blog explores the latest learning and enablement resources on SAP Document AI, as well as the bi-directional integration between Joule and Microsoft 365 Copilot. We also dive into some key resources to help you get started building your own Joule agents.

Building on my first blog, where I introduced you to our AI live sessions Beyond Hype (which is all about getting productive with SAP Business AI), I wanted to address some of your most asked questions:

  1. How can I enable SAP Document AI on my mobile device?
    SAP Document AI also supports mobile use cases, ideally for employees working remotely or in the field who need to submit documents while on the go. Within SAP Mobile Start, you can configure Document AI as a target, then take a picture and automatically upload it for processing. Find out here how to integrate and launch SAP Document AI on mobile. If you haven’t set up SAP Document AI yet, you want to check out the steps here.

    Did you know about the recent feature release: Inbound and outbound channel support, which allows you to connect your e-mail server, as many document-related use cases involve e-mail. For now, only Microsoft Outlook is supported, but this enables you to fetch the e-mail, extract both the e-mail body and attachments, such as Excel files. For e-mail ingestion, you don’t need BPA integration; you can also use our e-mail ingestion feature without BPA by configuring your e-mail inbox as an inbound channel in our UI. Read more about the Q4/25 Release Highlights here and follow the documentation to register an e-mail app here.

    Stay up to date with SAP Road Map Explorer and learn how you will benefit from SAP Document AI in upcoming releases.

  2. Where can we find instructions for setting up the bi-directional integration between Joule and Microsoft 365 Copilot?
    The great thing is that you can get started today with Joule Base and a Microsoft 365 license by downloading the SAP Joule app from the Microsoft Marketplace (M365 Copilot license required when using M365 Copilot skills in Joule web client in your SAP Application). Then follow the SAP Help documentation to set up the connection between Cloud Identity Services on SAP BTP & Microsoft Entra, and consider a few technical pre-requisites:
    1.  Is Joule activated in at least one SAP Business Applications (e.g., SAP SuccessFactors or SAP S/4HANA Cloud), and do you have administrator access to SAP Cloud Identity Services, SAP Business Technology Platform (BTP), and Microsoft Entra? Yes? Great, read on!
    2.  Next, you need to:
    • Configure Microsoft Entra as your Corporate Identity Provider
    • Enable Joule to Pass Requests to Microsoft Copilot and Teams
    • Joule Formation to be included with MS Copilot Integration in your system landscape

     Watch my colleague @nageshcaparthy  demo the setup process! 

     

  3. May we use Joule within Microsoft 365 Copilot (and vice versa) when handling confidential data?
    Did you know that Joule and Copilot are only exchanging the user prompt and displaying the result in their respective UIs? Through Identity Propagation between Microsoft Entra and Cloud Identity Services on SAP BTP, Joule and Microsoft 365 Copilot are aware of a user’s roles and permissions for a secure integration. Watch the video and see the two Copilots work together in action! 

     

Want to dive deeper into the content? Rewatch the sessions and access the session material via SAP Learning Hub (subscription required):

  • Getting Started with SAP Document AI: Activate, Automate, Act (recording)
  • Two Copilots, One Goal: Smarter Productivity with Joule and Microsoft 365 Copilot (recording)

Speaking of automation and productivity, have you heard that Agent builder in Joule Studio is now generally available? The agent builder enables developers to create Joule agents tailored to their unique business requirements, breaking cross-ecosystem silos and reducing barriers to AI adoption. Read on in Michael Ameling’s Blog, President of SAP Business Technology Platform, to explore key highlights of the release, everyday use cases for Joule agents, and get insights into the roadmap. 

Here are your key resources to help you get started building your own Joule agents:

  • How to Get Started with Joule Studio: Prerequisites, Commercials, and Instructions to begin using Joule Studio 
  • Joule Studio Goes Live: Answers to Your Top Questions covering Skills and the new Agent Builder features 
  • Create an Agent in Joule Studio: Step-by-step tutorial on how to build and test an agent in Joule Studio
  • Best Practices for Building Agents: Key principles and practices for designing effective Joule Agents 
  • Discovery Center Mission: Get Hands-on experience in creating a Joule Agent with multiple skills and MCP

Hi Joule, where should I get started with the latest learning resources? *

Apart from live enablement sessions, explore our latest on-demand learning resources:

  • To all partners: Test, demo, and develop with Joule and Microsoft 365 Copilot by purchasing the Joule Base TDD entitlement (8020592) and any Microsoft 365 environment (you don't necessarily need M365 Copilot to get started). Check out the Microsoft 365 Developer Program to get started.
  • Get hands-on with SAP Document AI! Pre-configured content is automatically delivered as part of the application and can be activated in the schema UI or via the schema APIs. In the video, you will learn how to create your own schemas from scratch in the SAP Document AI workspace. Now it’s your turn - Go ahead and try it yourself! 

     

* Powered by the machine learning technology of SAP AI Business Services, personalized recommendations are generated for employees, in one place on the Learning home page, based on employee data.

As we look ahead, we’re excited to share with you a new lineup of learning opportunities designed to help you expand your knowledge and make AI an advantage in your role:

  • February 5: What’s New in SAP Build Q4 2025 Option 1 9 am CET - Option 2 4 pm CET
  • February 10, 5 pm CET: Reimagining Business Processes with Joule Agents. Discover how Joule Agents, embedded in core business processes, help organizations transition from insight to action.

Stay tuned for more, and happy learning! 🚀

Further Resources:

  • From Hype to Hands-On: Level Up Your AI Skills This October
  • From Hype to Hands-On: Level Up Your AI Skills This November
  • From Hype to Hands-On: Level Up Your AI Skills This December

Joule Joule Studio SAP Document AI #Microsoft 365 Copilot SAP Mobile Services

entry.title: How AI in SAP Sales & Service Cloud V2 Is Transforming CRM Adoption, Execution, and Business Value
entry.content:
⏱This article takes about 10 minutes to read

Introduction

Sales and service organizations are operating under unprecedented pressure. Customers expect fast, relevant, and personalized interactions, while internal teams are tasked with managing increased complexity, more data, and multiple channels - often with the same or fewer resources.

SAP Sales & Service Cloud Version 2 represents a fundamental shift in how CRM supports this reality. It is no longer just a system of record, but a system of intelligence, guidance, and automation, powered by SAP Business AI.

Today, SAP delivers 30+ AI capabilities and use cases connected to Sales and Service Cloud V2, spanning Machine Learning, predictive AI, generative productivity, and agentic automation. This article explains what those capabilities are, how they map to real sales and service processes, and how the next evolution - AI Agents - builds on this foundation without hype or overstatement.

That being said, this blog is intended as a practical SAP Sales and Service V2 AI reference asset for consultants, architects, CIOs, IT leaders, and business stakeholders.

Why AI in CRM Is No Longer Optional

Most CRM challenges today are not caused by a lack of functionality. They stem from missing context and excessive manual effort.

Sales and service teams commonly struggle with:

  • Manually searching through emails, documents, complex Excel spreadsheets, and historical cases
  • Repeating administrative documentation instead of engaging customers
  • Interpreting customer intent across fragmented interactions
  • Scaling personalization across regions and languages
  • Knowing which lead, opportunity, or case deserves attention - now!

AI in Sales & Service Cloud V2 directly addresses these challenges inside the flow of work, reducing friction instead of adding new tools.

One Coherent AI Strategy with Complementary Layers

SAP structures AI for Sales & Service Cloud V2 across three complementary layers – where Joule Premium for CX accommodates both premium embedded AI and CX AI toolkit use cases. Together, they enable 30+ AI capabilities, each optimized for a specific class of problems and business outcomes.  See examples below, connected to the main AI focus:

 

Base AI — Predictive & Classification Intelligence

Base AI focuses on machine learning–driven insights such as prediction, classification, recommendation, and language processing. These capabilities are embedded into Sales and Service Cloud and are available without additional licensing complexity.

Core Base AI Capabilities:

For Sales ScenariosFor Service ScenariosCross-functional Scenarios
  •  Lead & Deal Intelligence (scoring and prioritization)
  • Product Recommendation
  • Business Interaction Intelligence
  • Business Text Intelligence
  • Case Categorization
  • Case Type Determination
  • Similar Case Recommendation
  • Case Topic Analyzer
  • NLP Classification (including sentiment analysis use cases)
  • Profanity Check
  • Machine Translation

 

💡When Base AI is the right choice - Use Base AI when the problem is repeatable, data-driven, and benefits from historical patterns. It delivers fast ROI with minimal disruption and strong explainability.

 

Embedded Premium AI — Generative Productivity Inside CRM

Embedded Premium AI introduces generative intelligence directly into CRM objects in both Sales & Services business objects, transforming structured and unstructured data into concise summaries, insights, and written content.

Core Embedded Premium AI Capabilities

For Sales ScenariosFor Service ScenariosCross-functional Scenarios
    • Account Synopsis
    • Sales Order Summary
    • Survey Trend Summary
    • Lead Booster
    • Email Draft Recommender
  • Case Summary
  • Registered Product Summary
  • Business Information Extraction
  • Email Draft Recommender
  • Utilities Insights
  • Duplicate Check

 

💡When Embedded Premium AI is the right choice
Use it when speed, productivity, and cognitive load reduction are the primary goals -  especially for frontline sales and service users.

 

CX AI Toolkit — Generative, Custom, and Agentic AI

The CX AI Toolkit is where AI becomes configurable, extensible, and increasingly autonomous. It allows organizations to connect AI to enterprise data, define their own use cases, and move beyond assistance toward execution.

Core CX AI Toolkit Capabilities: 

Knowledge & Generative AIAutonomous AI Agents Extensibility
  • Intelligent Q&A
  • Smart Actions
  • Intelligent Customer Profile
  • Autonomous AI Agents 
  • Case Classification Agent
  •  Q&A Agent
  • Quote Creation Agent (Only available for V1 for now, though a similar agent is part of the new & coming set of Agents for V2)
  • Digital Service Agent
  • Knowledge Creation Agent
  • AI Tools (sales & service content tools as one capability area)
  • Custom Tool Builder
  • Custom Agent Builder

 

💡When the Toolkit is the right choice
Use it when AI must span multiple steps, integrate enterprise knowledge, or act autonomously rather than simply recommend.

 

Business Process - AI Across the Sales and Service v2 Lifecycle

Across lead management, opportunity execution, visits, and order handling, SAP provides a broad set of AI capabilities tightly aligned to sales processes.

Example of Sales Process powered by SAP Business AI:

Key outcomes include:

  • Predictive prioritization of leads and opportunities
  • Faster and better-informed account preparation
  • AI-generated discovery questions and follow-up emails
  • Survey-driven insights for visit planning
  • Automated quote handling through AI Agents

That said, and as illustrated in the picture above, Sales Cloud V2 evolves from a tracking system into a decision-support and execution assistant.

Regarding Service Cloud V2 applies AI across intake, understanding, resolution, and knowledge creation, reducing both handling time and customer effort.

Example of Service Process powered by SAP Business AI

Key outcomes include:

  • Automated categorization and routing of incoming cases
  • Instant understanding through summaries of long interaction histories
  • Faster resolution using similar-case intelligence
  • Entity extraction from unstructured emails and documents
  • Continuous growth of the knowledge base through AI Agents

That said, and as illustrated in the picture above, Service Cloud v2 moves from reactive ticket handling to proactive resolution orchestration.

Intelligent Q&A: The Foundation of Trustworthy AI

Intelligent Q&A, powered by RAG (Retrieval-Augmented Generation), is one of the core building blocks behind the 30+ AI use cases in SAP Sales & Service Cloud V2. In simple terms, it allows people — and AI Agents — to ask questions in plain language and get answers backed by real CRM data and enterprise documents, with source references for transparency. 

Sometimes customers notice that answers vary in quality. That’s usually because of how RAG works under the hood: the system looks for the most relevant pieces of information across indexed files, emails, tickets, and product data, and then asks the LLM to generate a grounded answer. The model is probabilistic, so answers can change slightly from one attempt to the next, even when grounded in the same data.

See details about the flow in the image below:

In practice, results get better when the indexed content is well structured (e.g., clean text-based documents). With that in mind, questions that ask for guidance or clarification (e.g., “how to” or “what is the policy…”) tend to produce the most accurate answers.
Examples include resolving an issue, understanding a process, or checking a product policy. On the other hand, requests that ask for summaries, counts, or cross-object overviews don’t perform as well, such as asking for opportunity summaries or ticket totals.

At a higher level, Intelligent Q&A gives organizations something essential: AI that can be explained, audited, and trusted by CIOs, architects, and compliance teams — which is why it’s such a critical foundation for enterprise AI.

From Assistance to Autonomy: The New Role of CX AI Agents

SAP’s CX AI Agents are moving customer experience from “AI that assists humans” to “AI that performs routine work autonomously” — all while staying connected to SAP Sales & Service Cloud V2 data, business logic, and governance.

Instead of generic chatbots, these agents are designed to perform specific enterprise tasks such as classifying tickets, creating knowledge articles, answering product questions, or compiling case information. They combine:

✔ Continuous context awareness (tickets, emails, catalog, meeting transcripts)
✔ Task execution using CX AI Toolkit tools and CRM APIs
✔ Business guardrails (policies, confidence scores, approvals)

Depending on the use case, agents can either assist or fully automate workflows.

Examples of Autonomous & Semi-Autonomous CX Agents

  • Case Classification Agent → categorizes incoming cases based on business rules
  • Knowledge Creation Agent → generates KBAs from new tickets
  • Digital Service Agent → responds to common inquiries in natural language
  • Q&A Agent → answers operational questions using CRM, ticket, or product data
  • Custom AI Agents → automate organization-specific tasks using custom prompts and tools

This model doesn’t eliminate humans — it shifts them toward value work, while AI handles:

  • First-level inquiries
  • Case enrichment & categorization
  • Article creation
  • Data retrieval & validation
  • Repetitive information lookups

Human-in-the-Loop by Design

When confidence is low or approvals are required, the agent automatically escalates. This ensures:

  • Control over sensitive actions
  • Transparency on data sources
  • Trust for compliance & audit teams

The long-term outcome is not human replacement, but:

  • Fewer manual clicks
  • Faster resolutions
  • Better customer responses
  • Higher productivity for sales & service teams

As organizations add custom prompts and tools, CX AI Agents become an orchestration layer between enterprise data, SAP applications, and human expertise, supporting a realistic pathway toward automation in Sales & Service Cloud V2.

Adoption Guidance – Matching Business Needs to the Right AI Use Case

 

Examples of lenses and guidance to consider​:

Or rather, a simple and defensible adoption lens could be :

  • Base AI → Prediction, scoring, and classification
  • Embedded Premium AI → Summaries, narratives, productivity acceleration
  • CX AI Toolkit & Agents → Automation, autonomy, and customization

The objective is not “more AI”, but clear value, no overlap, and controlled total cost of ownership.

Furthermore, there are several assets available that can support you, provide adoption guidance, and inform your decision-making. Please see below:

  • Joule Premium Adoption Playbook for SAP Sales and Service Cloud (More CX AI toolkit capabilities focused)
  • Mastering the AI Mindset - Co-Creating the Future of AI & Customer Experience with SAP CX
  • The Art of Possible: Why Now Is the Time for SAP Sales and Service AI Agents in Customer Experience
  • AI Value Calculator - Calculate your potential savings
  • PUMP Package – SAP Joule Premium for Customer Experience
  • SAP Business AI estimator

Agentic AI - What’s Coming Next

Agentic AI in SAP Sales Cloud v2: Join the Customer Engagement Initiative

See more HERE.

And also, roadmap explorer HERE.

Final Takeaway: AI as a CRM Operating Model

SAP Sales & Service Cloud V2 now delivers:

  • 30+ AI capabilities available today
  • A clear progression from insight → productivity → autonomy
  • A trusted AI foundation aligned with enterprise governance

For consultants, architects, CIOs, and business leaders, this is no longer an innovation discussion. It is an operating model decision that defines how customer-facing teams work at scale. Organizations that adopt AI intentionally will not just work faster — they will work smarter, with less friction and more impact.

Thank you for reading, and please don't hesitate to reach out if you need any support.

entry.title: Joule with SAP Signavio Is Now GA: Your Conversational Gateway to Process Transformation
entry.content:
We’ve got exciting news to share: Joule with SAP Signavio solutions* is now generally available.

After months of successful collaboration with customers in our Early Adopter Care (EAC) program, this launch marks a major step towards delivering a conversational experience making it easier than ever to explore, understand, manage and transform your processes with SAP Signavio solutions.

In this blog, we’ll dive into the world of Joule with SAP Signavio, exploring real-world examples of how Joule can be leveraged to quickly access information, navigate process assets, and execute actions with ease. We’ll discuss why Joule’s integration across SAP applications matters and the strategic evolution to advanced agentic AI capabilities.

Finally, we will provide indications on how to activate Joule in SAP Signavio, so that you can get started straight away!

Joule with SAP Signavio solutions

What is Joule

Joule is an AI solution that helps teams act with clarity and collaborate without silos. It turns siloed data and tasks into intelligent, connected workflows that help improve decisions, speed up end-to-end processes, and create a unified AI experience across SAP and non-SAP systems. With AI agents for all core functions, powered by SAP business process expertise, your AI strategy scales faster and wider. 

Inside SAP Signavio, Joule becomes your process companion, helping you navigate, analyze and manage your processes through natural language.

The unique value? Deep process context from SAP Signavio combined with orchestration across SAP applications, including but not limited to SAP S/4HANA, SAP BTP, and SAP SuccessFactors.

Joule offers a seamless user experience across SAP and non-SAP systems allowing employees to ask questions and interact with Joule from anywhere. While working in SAP Signavio, users can interact with data and capabilities from other systems and/or while in other systems, they can access SAP Signavio capabilities. 

How Joule with SAP Signavio Helps You Work Smarter 

Now generally available, Joule with SAP Signavio delivers over 50 skills across three use cases - Informational, Navigational, and Transactional – with additional Analytical capabilities planned for future releases. 

These interaction patterns are designed to simplify your day-to-day tasks.

  • Informational: Joule acts as an intelligent assistant, helping users understand how to perform specific tasks or generating a textual comparison between processes. For example, you can ask Joule: “What’s the difference between draft and published process models?” or “How can I set up a dashboard?”
  • Navigational:  Joule simplifies content navigation across SAP Signavio solutions and guides users through the SAP Signavio Process Collaboration Hub to access various assets such as process and journey models, and value accelerators. For example, you can ask Joule: “Open the Order-to-Cash process model published for EMEA” or “Find accelerators for the Financial Process”
  • Transactional: Joule enables users to perform actions conversationally, such as creating and deleting assets within the SAP Signavio Process Transformation Suite, including processes, journey models, and dictionary items. For example, you can tell Joule: “Create a new dictionary term and link it to the Returns process.” or “Delete the journey model called Sales Process”

Find here the full list of Joule skills in SAP Signavio.

A Real-World Example 

Imagine you're an end-user exploring the SAP Signavio Process Collaboration Hub. You want to learn more about a specific process documented in SAP Signavio—let’s say the "Order to Cash" process..  

  • You can ask Joule: “Who is the process owner of the Order to cash process?” → Joule skills suggest the process that most closely matches your query and retrieve the owner information from the diagram attributes. 
  • You can then ask Joule: “Provide me with a description of the process flow” →  Joule skills convert the process visual into a clear process description.

Moreover, as an end-user, you may want to identify discrepancies between two different process models, in our example “Procure to Pay – Global" and “Procure to Pay – EU”.

  • You can ask Joule: “Compare process models “Procure to Pay – Global” with “Procure to Pay – EU”   → Joule skills provide a textual summary which highlights the key differences between the two process models.

What used to take hours now happens in minutes - through a simple conversation.

Why Joule Across SAP Applications Matters  

Joule isn’t limited to SAP Signavio. It works across SAP applications**.  That means: 

  • One unified AI experience: Joule works across SAP applications including, amongst others, SAP S/4HANA, SAP SuccessFactors, SAP BTP. This means that SAP Signavio process context and intelligence is now accessible to the user across all Joule-compatible applications.
  • Process-aware orchestration:  Joule does not just answer questions, but it understands and can orchestrate actions and recommendations.
  • Responsible AI: Responsible AI at SAP is based on three pillars: ethics, security, and compliance. Joule provides grounded answers and governance for enterprise trust, as it’s built on enterprise-grade AI, and can safely operate at the heart of your business. Process ownership and access are respected, and AI can be scaled confidently across your processes.   

Joule Agents for SAP Signavio

SAP is developing Joule Agents embedded into every business function and accessed with role-based assistants. They use SAP’s process expertise to automate complex workflows and deliver AI value at scale.

Joule Agents for SAP Signavio solutions can help you accelerate content discovery and process analysis, create value cases and enhance user onboarding.

Five Joule Agents for SAP Signavio are now available as part of a dedicated beta program:

  • Dashboard Analyzer Agent explains insights and drives process improvements in SAP Signavio.
  • Process Content Recommender Agent intelligently recommends relevant process content in SAP Signavio.
  • Screen Guide Agent accelerates understanding and adoption of SAP Signavio
  • Value Case Creation Agent turns process insights into actionable value cases in SAP Signavio
  • Workspace Administration Agent onboards new process experts quickly in SAP Signavio.

Overview of the Process Content Recommender Agent 

To learn more about Joule Agents for SAP Signavio solutions and our beta program, read here.

 How to Activate Joule in SAP Signavio 

Visit this page to learn how to activate Joule Base in your environment.

Learn more about Joule

To learn more about Joule and Joule  with SAP Signavio solutions check the following additional resources:

  • Joule in SAP Signavio Help Portal
  • SAP Discovery Center AI Feature - SAP Signavio solutions, Joule
  • REGISTER NOW: SAP Joule Agents in SAP Signavio Bet... - SAP Community

 

*Joule is currently not available in SAP Signavio Process Insights or SAP Signavio Process Governance.

**To enable this unified experience, the right connections must be set up. Learn more: Joule - Unified Setup: Bridging Simplicity and Per... - SAP Community 

Any thoughts or questions? Please share any feedback or thoughts in a comment.
